intro: Chaerophyllum macropodum, commonly known as the large-footed hogweed, is a herbaceous plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and umbel-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. It has a taproot system and can reach heights of up to 1.5 meters. Its flowers are usually white or pale green, and it produces small, dry fruits that are dispersed by wind.
